reviews.title: The owners are really great people

reviews.title: All we could ask for!
Terrific place and service to match!
reviews.text: Larry the Owner Personally will drive you downtown in his Vintage Limo.... Judy makes your dinner reservations and spa appointments.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had a few days and were in desperate need of sun and relaxation. We found the hotel on the website; smallhotelsofpalmsprings.com. There is a reason this hotel is ranked #1! The hotel's website looked inviting so we called and were immediately made to feel welcomed after speaking with Judy on the phone. You feel relaxed and cared for the moment you walk on to the property. Larry, one of the owners, goes out of his way, as does everyone else to ensure that your stay is a relaxing one. The rooms are more than clean and comfortable. Each room has complementary snacks and a fridge with various beverages. Larry made sure we had everything we needed, introduced us to other guests and made himself more than available should we require anything at all. There are bicycles on the property should you choose to use one. There are fresh pastries and newspapers each morning. There is a firepit that you can sit around in evenings and look up at the stars. The rooms surround a beautiful pool and incredible landscaping. I cannont say enough about this hotel except to say that if you want to relax and like being pampered please do yourself a favor and make a reservation. We liked it so much we are going back in January!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Experience !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't wait to go back to the Desert Riviera. This hotel has a bed and breakfast feel since there are only 10 rooms surrounding the heated pool. All rooms have a view of the mountain. Yes, the rooms are newly remodeled, spacious, clean, and bright and the bed/linens...fabulous! We didn't take advantage of the kitchenettes but it was nice to have cold beverages waiting in the fridge for you when you got back to your room after chillin in the pool with the other guests (that all become your friends by the end of your visit). Judy and Larry rock! Judy helped plan my weekend since I was surprising my bf, Loran, for his bday. She made dinner reservations for us, scheduled a couples massage (which was heavenly) and even picked up a cake for me. Michael (the limo driver) took us out and brought us home each night. The limo definitely added an old skool palm springs vibe to the night. We loved the fire pit, beautiful grounds, the free movies (what a fun collection of movies...all my favorites), the tasty brewskis and the amazing company we had. The atmosphere is so comfortable and relaxing that it was tough leaving the place to explore the area. We were too lazy to take a ride on the bikes that they had available to borrow but we'll make sure to next time. Couples, friends or staying solo...all will enjoy the Desert Riviera. You are sure to have a goooooooooooood time!
reviews.title: Desert Riviera Rules Palm Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with Larry and the gang the weekend of Dec 1st, 2007 it was raining (for the first time in 16 months) but had a wonderful stay. Larry brought his "A" game and made sure that the weather didn't hamper our stay. He offered to take us where ever we wanted to go in the limo and checked up on us through out our stay. My husband and I were surprised Larry had learned our name after the moment we checked in. The other guests staying were super friendly and it really had a great atmosphere. Our room was the cleanest I encountered at a hotel and we enjoyed the extra touches the room provided such as kitchen, flat panel TV and art deco style decor. The service was the best! We don't live that close by but are looking forward to returning whenever possible. Thanks Larry for the great stay and the tip of needing warm clothes to take in the tram ride :)
reviews.title: Larry and the Gang are the Best!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Desert Riviera Hotel in mid-November and loved it. I must say that everything I read on TripAdvisor was right. Larry and his crew were amazingly friendly and helpful, his restaurant recommendations were right on (loved Al Dente Pasta!) and his willingness to make dinner reservations and drive us in his white limo was such a nice touch. He truly took the guess work out of a pleasant Palm Springs Weekend. All we can talk about is when we're going back. Thanks so much Larry! ~Veronica & Chris
reviews.title: Living up to the Hype!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very difficult to add to what numerous reviewers have already said about this fantastic hotel. We saw this was rated number 1 on trip advisor and this prompted us to book 4 nights in room number 9. What a great decision. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel completely at home, firstly by Bob (Patty's Dad) then by Larry and Patty. Greeted by first names everything was explained to us including restaurant recommendations. The room itself is spacious, clean, great decor, with everything you need including fridge/freezer microwave coffee maker. Extra touches include free snacks and drinks in the rooms, coffee and doughnuts in the lobby with the newspapers, and free local and international calls on the cordless phone. The nicest touch being the limo service where Larry himself drove us to and fro to a nearby restaurant.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is hard not to reiterate what everyone else says about this spectacular little hotel. It is exactly what you read - immaculate, funky, beautiful, and unique. So instead I'll tell you what the staff did for us. My husband and I arrived in a rented vintage volkswagon camper van, that had started stalling from Joshua Tree to Palm Springs. It was a hot day, our nerves were thin due to the stalling, and when we finally puttered up the Desert Riviera, we were immediately welcomed by Larry with a cold beer for my husband, which he so needed. Long story short, we planned on staying just one night before heading to San Clemente, but between the car problems, coupled with the fact we simply could not bring ourselves to leave this gem, we decided to stay two nights. We lounged by the pool, enjoyed the mountain views, we took the cruiser bikes out for a self guided architecture tour, and we slept in in the luxurious bed. Judy and Bob were delightful, and it was really fun to take the limo to dinner in town, and not worry about drinking and driving. To top everything off, Larry knows a little something about old vw's (of course!) and actually fixed our van.
reviews.title: The BEST hotel I've ever stayed in

likes.disliked: — I guess the cigar smell near the pool

reviews.text: In summary, we absolutely our time there, and hope to make it back again. It was fabulous.
reviews.title: Desert Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relaxing. Retro. Intimate. Those are the words I would use to describe this wonderful little place. Several of my co-workers and I had a seminar to attend in the area and the company had negotiated a rate at the Spa Hotel and Casino for attendees. Since I love tripadvisor and finding unique places to stay, I called Judy and she gladly matched the rate we would have had at the other property. Granted, I brought 5 other travelers - a couple staying one or two nights and the rest 3-5 nights, so we nearly had the place to ourselves during the week.
reviews.title: A very relaxing week

reviews.text: We regretted that our 2 night stay wasn't longer; that we didn't have enough time to enjoy the exquisite gardens more or take a dip in the delightful pool; that we weren't able to take a ride in the complimentary limo or use the free bicycles. And most of all - we regretted having to leave at all!
reviews.title: The Reviews Are True! Stay Here And Feel Like Family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just lovely. The rooms are spotless (they put my housekeeping to shame!). The kitchenette was so handy and appreciated. We loved the wooden Venetian blinds and the flat-screen TV with built-in DVD player (DVD's available in the common area by the office - free!).
reviews.title: Perfect!!!

description: Amazing renovation of a beautiful vintage property, that takes you back to the old Palm Springs feel. Panoramic view of the San Jacinto mountains, impressing clean and manicured gardens. Sparkling pool and hot tub and poolside guest barbecue. Personal attention to every guest, Customer Service is #1. Come feel the vibe.
